publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2976# Cathie Craigie: The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals-That the Parliament notes the successful reopening of the Forth and Clyde Canal; further notes that the reopening of the canal has given the communities on its banks a major boost; looks forward to the next step in this project which, on 24 May 2002, sees the opening of the Falkirk Wheel and the resulting link between the Forth and Clyde Canal and the Union Canal; congratulates the board of British Waterways, the Forth and Clyde Canal Society, the Scottish Inland Waterways Association, Scottish Enterprise, North Lanarkshire Council, Falkirk Council, Glasgow City Council, the City of Edinburgh Council, West Lothian Council, East Dunbartonshire Council and West Dunbartonshire Council on working in partnership in order to make this ambitious project a reality, and believes that the Scottish Executive should work together with VisitScotland and Scottish Enterprise in order to maximise the benefits of this project for the local economies, especially local tourism.
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Michael Matheson*, Bill Butler*

S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Michael McMahon*, Kate Maclean*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Mr John McAllion*, Helen Eadie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Scott Barrie*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Janis Hughes*, Des McNulty*, Trish Godman*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Rhoda Grant*, Robert Brown*, Bristow Muldoon*, Cathie Craigie*, Jackie Baillie*, Johann Lamont*, Iain Smith*

S1M-2976# Cathie Craigie: The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals-That the Parliament notes the successful reopening of the Forth and Clyde Canal; further notes that the reopening of the canal has given the communities on its banks a major boost; looks forward to the next step in this project which, on 24 May 2002, sees the opening of the Falkirk Wheel and the resulting link between the Forth and Clyde Canal and the Union Canal; congratulates the board of British Waterways, the Forth and Clyde Canal Society, the Scottish Inland Waterways Association, Scottish Enterprise, North Lanarkshire Council, Falkirk Council, Glasgow City Council, the City of Edinburgh Council, West Lothian Council, East Dunbartonshire Council and West Dunbartonshire Council on working in partnership in order to make this ambitious project a reality, and believes that the Scottish Executive should work together with VisitScotland and Scottish Enterprise in order to maximise the benefits of this project for the local economies, especially local tourism. Supported by: Marilyn Livingstone, Michael Matheson, Bill Butler, Mr Michael McMahon, Kate Maclean, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mr John McAllion, Helen Eadie, Margaret Jamieson, Scott Barrie, Brian Fitzpatrick, Janis Hughes, Des McNulty, Trish Godman, Rhoda Grant, Robert Brown, Bristow Muldoon, Jackie Baillie, Johann Lamont, Iain Smith, Nora Radcliffe, Sarah Boyack*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Dennis Canavan*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Ian Jenkins*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Karen Gillon*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Susan Deacon*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-2976# The Forth and Clyde and Union Canals (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
